title: What is the best lane to climb out of silver elo?
body:
My main is support and i admit i'm not doing anything useful, it's mainly my fault. What lane could i play to contribute more, and make the game more winnable?

Just being particularly strong in your role makes a huge difference, especially if you can do so from a role that typically isn't very strong. Support is a great example. A lot of supports end up being heal bots, and spam healing allies that aren't dealing a whole lot of damage isn't going to amount to much. If instead you take a champion that can be powerful on a support's gold and exp budget, you're going to have a major impact on the game. 

Personally, this is one thing I really enjoy about playing Pantheon as a support. Get two or three kills / assists on him, buy some Mobility Boots and a Serrated Dirk, hit level 6, and you're a global threat. 

Similarly with Bard. Learn the pattern for when is the proper time to leave your carry bot so you can roam to collect chimes. This gives you great mobility, mana sustain, and supplemental experience. When you accumulate enough chimes you can deal about as much damage as your carry, and the mobility allows you to keep side lanes pushed and get back to your team for fights. Remember, that pushing minion waves basically work as an extra champion on your team. While you're fighting with your team over lane control or objectives, your minions will work their way to the enemy tower, or the enemy team needs to send someone to deal with them, giving your team the numbers advantage.

I mean, .. sure, there are better positions to more consistently influence the game from. I was more keying on the fact that the OP, and myself, typically play support. 

Most ideally, the best role to carry from would be jungle, but jungle is in such a difficult position right now that I wouldn't recommend that anyone who doesn't already know how to play it very well would try to learn it as it is. 

Mid would probably be next, being the most central role. It is also probably the most popular and most competitive role. Mid-meta champions also tend to have the steepest level of difficulty. Further, the best mid carries require the ability to influence the rest of the map through roaming. 

Bottom might be the next most familiar role to someone that plays support, but it is also one of the easiest roles to get tilted off the face of Runeterra from. With as much priority on Dragon, Bottom has the most pressure to establish lane presence, and there is the most punishment for misplaying. 

Lastly, Top ... Pretty feast or famine. One top laner bullies the other into the fetal position, or you go even until team fights start. If you can be the bully, great.

Only way to climb is literally to take a champion that can take every objective while also being able to kill people
If you aren't solo taking every tower and objective, it IS your fault you lost
If you aren't helping to kill every laner in every lane (including jungle), you lost the game by not doing enough
You need to be placing every ward available exactly when it's available. Of course that includes buying pinks. At least 300 gold worth per match. Who else would provide vision if not for you? Other laners? You're just shifting the blame, friend
You need to be doing everything in the game all at once, solo. If you can't 1v5, it IS your fault you're losing.
You disagree with any of this? Clearly you're just bad, and you don't get how the game works. Trust me, Riot has been telling us to tell each other this for years.

What has worked for me is find a reliable duo. They dont need to be be gods at the game or even carry you but at the very least you know they wont hard feed and on the off game they do they know how to bring it back. I also found one champion I am very good at and can win lane majority of games and just play that.

You can climb in every role and almost any champion however the time it takes can be longer. You pretty much need pug stompers to climb in low elos. For example in Bronze/Silver support, play a support that can carry games and avoid ones that rely too heavily on the team(yuumi comes to mind).

Out of silver and below - Toplane, 100%. If you have 3 brain cells and just spam juggernauts you'll make it to low gold eventually. The meta for bronze and silver isn't assassins. It isn't ADCs. It's not mages. It is, always has been, and always will be, juggernauts, which are mostly played toplane. Better juggernaut wins, and the team with the most juggernauts will win most of the time (assuming there's no stupid off-lane shit).

Sure, if you're more skilled you'll be able to win on anything. However, juggernauts are by *far* the easiest role to win with in bronze and silver. Most ADCs don't know how to kite and most teams can't peel worth a shit, so juggernauts will, 9/10 times, just walk up to the ADC and murder their face in, then murder the rest of the team.

No promises that'll be the case once you're out of silver, but it should work out fine until you hit gold.

However, that's just if you want out of silver the easiest way. You can still very much carry as a support, so there's no need to switch lanes. That *does* require getting better at the game and working on your problem areas, though, which is a lot more work than just learning Mundo, Darius, and Nasus.
